alert.note: Alert for Coastal York; Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern York and east central Strafford Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 241 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near South Berwick, or 8 miles northwest of Kittery, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rochester, Alfred, Sanford, Dover, Somersworth, Kennebunk, Berwick, South Berwick, York, Wells, Eliot, Lyman, Ogunquit, Rollinsford, and North Berwick. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 10 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southwestern Maine...and southern and central New Hampshire.
